{"step_by_step_thinking": "Acute Rheumatic fever is a disease that can develop as a complication of inadequately treated strep throat or scarlet fever, which are caused by an infection with group A streptococcus bacteria. The major clinical manifestations of acute rheumatic fever include carditis, polyarthritis, chorea, erythema marginatum, and subcutaneous nodules. Abdominal pain is not a recognized manifestation of acute Rheumatic fever. Epistaxis, or nosebleeds, is also not a recognized manifestation of acute Rheumatic fever.", "answer_choice": "D. ab"}
